author: Dabi_Aljv
title: RTC slows down after a few minutes and doesn't keep the correct time pace | Electronics Forum (Circuits, Projects and Microcontrollers)
text:
Hello everyone.
I'm working on an automatic irrigation system using Arduino Mega 2560, TFT screen ILI9488, RTC module DS3231 and a KY-023 joystick module in a physical assembly (schematics are shown below).
Everything works fine. The problem is that the RTC doesn't keep the correct time. When the system is switched on, after a few minutes it starts to get delayed by seconds. The more time it is on, the more delay it gets. I'll leave the code I used here. It's a long code, mainly because of the screen part (it's also in Spanish, as it's my first language, you could ask some AI to translate the comments for you, sorry for that).
I would be very grateful for your help. Thanks in advance.
I'm working on an automatic irrigation system using Arduino Mega 2560, TFT screen ILI9488, RTC module DS3231 and a KY-023 joystick module in a physical assembly (schematics are shown below).
Everything works fine. The problem is that the RTC doesn't keep the correct time. When the system is switched on, after a few minutes it starts to get delayed by seconds. The more time it is on, the more delay it gets. I'll leave the code I used here. It's a long code, mainly because of the screen part (it's also in Spanish, as it's my first language, you could ask some AI to translate the comments for you, sorry for that).
I would be very grateful for your help. Thanks in advance.

author: Tipranks
title: Cosmos Health appoints Dimitrios Trafalis as head of oncology
text:
Cosmos Health appoints Dimitrios Trafalis as head of oncology
Cosmos Health ([COSM](https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/cosm?utm_source=markets.businessinsider.com&utm_medium=referral)) announced the appointment of Professor Dimitrios Trafalis as Head of Oncology at the companyâ€™s Research and Development division. Trafalis currently serves as a Professor of Pharmacology and Clinical Pharmacology at the Faculty of Medicine, National and Kapodistrian University of Athens. Trafalis will lead research initiatives focusing on the design and execution of preclinical and clinical development strategies, regulatory support, and studies aimed at addressing critical oncology challenges. Specifically, his role includes overseeing preclinical and clinical protocols, making strategic decisions in research, and presenting key developments at global medical conferences and in international scientific journals.

author: Samuel Bryant
title: Musk reveals FSD Beta V12 passing through extra testing in anticipation of wider release
text: If you are awaiting the FSD [Beta V12](https://driveteslacanada.ca/tag/fsd-v12/) update, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has good news: the new update is undergoing extra testing before a wider release. The boss explained why extra testing is required on X (formerly known as Twitter). Musk said the new version is already running on a lot of cars. However, due to being a completely different architecture, the software update has to be tested more than usual. According to Musk, the FSD Beta V12 update already works well in California but needs more training for areas with higher precipitation. https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1740189939936248225?s=20 FSD Beta V12 takes the navigation software from a rules-based to a network-path-based AI method, meaning it will function based on human driving data rather than rules programmed into the software. One Tesla staff member on the FSD team boasted the new update will ensure an autonomous car never gets involved in a collision, â€œeven in unstructured environments.â€ Interestingly, this version might be the last to carry the Beta tag. Tesla [employees have been testing Beta V12 since last month](https://driveteslacanada.ca/news/tesla-fsd-v12-releases-to-employees-could-be-included-in-holiday-update/), according to Musk. More employees got the update in December. According to estimates, more than 15,000 Tesla employees have been running the update, with a general release expected toward the end of January 2024. [FSD may soon be available to Tesla users in China](https://driveteslacanada.ca/news/tesla-is-making-gradual-progress-in-bringing-fsd-to-china/). [click here to get 6 months of free Supercharging](https://www.tesla.com/referral/darryn55317)and a three month trial of Full Self-Driving (FSD).

author: J. Arturo Trujillo
title: Justin Herbert gave luggage and gift cards to the Chargers OL for Christmas | Marca
text:
The Los Angeles Cargers QB has a 5 year contract for 262.5 million dollars
J. ARTURO TRUJILLO 26/12/2024 - 16:05 CST
Compartir en Facebook
Compartir en Twitter
Compartir en Telegram
Compartir en Whatsapp
Enviar por email NFL. Jayden Daniels believes Travis Hunter can shine both ways in the NFL Houston Texans. CJ Stroud hasn't been the same player since giving advice to Bears rookie I t seems to be a tradition between the NFL quarterbacks to give something back to the most underrated players on the field; the OL.
Earliert this hollidays we have seen gifts like the one from Brock Purdy to his teammates, even when he still has a rookie contract. This time, the Chargers QB. Justin Herbert, gave to his whole OL a nice small gift.
Rashawn Slater sends his thanks to Justin Herbert after receiving cheap X-mas gift
He give a luggage and a $5K Delta giftcard , which social media started making jokes and comparissons with other QBs gifts around the X-mas season.
Justin Herbert tired of the Chargers? Chargers fans, known for their passionate support, were disappointed when quarterback Justin Herbert, despite his recent signing of a massive $262 million contract, allegedly displayed less than generous tipping behavior.
Ver esta publicaciÃ³n en Instagram This perceived stinginess sparked a wave of playful posts in online comment sections, with fans jokingly questioning Herbert's 'Christmas spirit' and playfully accusing him of 'penny-pinching.'
For the last weeks, they have been plenty of temas that have been related to the young QB, Oregon alumni. One of them the Seattle Seahawks who need to fill out the position with a true winner.

Este viernes tambiÃ©n se encontraba vigente una alerta amarilla por calor en el oeste de CÃ³rdoba y en el extremo noreste de San Luis, en las zonas bajas de Chacabuco, JunÃ­n y Libertador General San MartÃ­n. La alerta naranja por tormentas que implica "fenÃ³menos meteorolÃ³gicos peligrosos para la sociedad, la vida, los bienes y el medio ambiente" afectaba la maÃ±ana de este viernes al Litoral en el centro y sur de Misiones, y en el este de Corrientes, segÃºn informÃ³ el SMN. TambiÃ©n comprendÃ­a al centro y este de Salta, al sureste de Jujuy y a casi todo el territorio de la provincia de TucumÃ¡n. El Ã¡rea serÃ¡ afectada por tormentas, algunas localmente fuertes o severas, que estarÃ¡n acompaÃ±adas por fuerte actividad elÃ©ctrica, intensas rÃ¡fagas, caÃ­da de granizo de diversos tamaÃ±os, y abundante caÃ­da de agua en cortos perÃ­odos. El organismo nacional estimÃ³ para esas zonas valores de precipitaciÃ³n acumulada entre 50 y 110 milÃ­metros (mm), pudiendo ser superados en forma puntual. Por el nivel naranja el SMN recomendÃ³ a la poblaciÃ³n permanecer en construcciones cerradas como casas, escuelas o edificios; mantenerse lejos de artefactos elÃ©ctricos y evitar el uso de telÃ©fonos con cable; y quedarse en el interior del vehÃ­culo en caso de estar viajando. TambiÃ©n pidiÃ³ evitar circular por calles inundadas o afectadas y, si hay riesgo de que el agua ingrese en las viviendas, cortar el suministro elÃ©ctrico. âš  SAT | ALERTASâ€” SMN Alertas (@SMN_Alertas) [#SiHayAlertaEstateAlerta] InformaciÃ³n actualizada el 29 de diciembre de 2023 a las 07:01 h ðŸ‘‰MÃ¡s detalles en [https://t.co/AgvDHAWzAt] [pic.twitter.com/OHdSIKuQgt] [December 29, 2023] Por tormentas de menor intensidad regÃ­an alertas amarillas para el resto de las provincias de Misiones y Corrientes; el norte y centro de Santa Fe; todo el territorio de Chaco; el oeste de Formosa; el norte y este de Santiago del Estero; el centro de Jujuy; y el centro de Catamarca. Las tormentas tendrÃ¡n rÃ¡fagas intensas, fuerte actividad elÃ©ctrica, ocasional caÃ­da de granizo y abundante caÃ­da de agua en cortos perÃ­odos con valores de precipitaciÃ³n acumulada entre 20 y 80 mm. Para la poblaciÃ³n bajo alerta amarilla el SMN recomendÃ³ no sacar la basura; retirar objetos que impidan que el agua escurra; evitar actividades al aire libre; no refugiarse cerca de Ã¡rboles y postes de electricidad que puedan caerse; no permanecer en playas, rÃ­os, lagunas o piletas; y prestar atenciÃ³n ante la posible caÃ­da de granizo. El nivel amarillo implica "posibles fenÃ³menos meteorolÃ³gicos con capacidad de daÃ±o y riesgo de interrupciÃ³n momentÃ¡nea de actividades cotidianas", explicÃ³ el SMN.

author: Housnia Shams
title: Rite Aid to close another 100 stores across 11 states after bankruptcy filing - NewsBreak
text: Rite Aid is set to close 100 more stores in several US states after the struggling drugstore chain filed for bankruptcy protection for the second time. The latest closures were listed in court documents last week. It includes stores across California, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, New Hampshire, Virginia, Washington, Delaware and Ohio. It's unclear when the stores will shut their doors, but Rite Aid has indicated that all locations will eventually close or be sold to a new owner. The company runs more than 1,200 stores in 15 US states. Rite Aid filed for bankruptcy protection for a second time in May, with its CEO Matt Schroeder citing "financial challenges intensified by the rapidly evolving retail and healthcare landscapes." "We are encouraged by meaningful interest from a number of potential national and regional strategic acquirors," Schroeder said in May. "As we move forward, our key priorities are ensuring uninterrupted pharmacy services for our customers and preserving jobs for as many associates as possible." Rite Aid said it was using the Chapter 11 process to "pursue a sale of its prescriptions, pharmacy and front-end inventory, and other assets." Customers can continue to shop online and in stores in the meantime, including accessing prescriptions and immunizations. Rite Aid said it was working to transfer customer prescriptions to other pharmacies. The company secured nearly $2 billion from lenders to help fund it through bankruptcy. Rite Aid first filed for bankruptcy in October 2023, and emerged from Chapter 11 nearly a year later as a private company. Like many other drugstore chains, Rite Aid has faced several challenges including theft, court settlements over opioid prescriptions and the rise of online shopping.
